IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To serve lower income families in achieving societal and economic success.
IRS990.MissionDescription: To provide leadership, education and support to build thriving individuals, families and communities.
IRS990.Description: Transportation - This program provides transportation primarily to low income individuals to various health services. Annually there is in excess of 13 million miles driven and over 350,000 trips provided. Most of the rides are made in the western Maine region and are provided by over 350 volunteer drivers.

Activity2.Description: CHILDREN'S SERVICES - Provides Head Start, Early Head Start and day care services to families in two counties. Programs are available for infants through elementary school ages. Head Start services are provided to over 500 children and families and day care services are provided to close to 100 children.

Activity3.Description: Housing & Energy - This program provides a variety of services ranging from self-help home construction and housing weatherization and repair to energy efficiency and home environment upgrades. Depending on the program, clients and families served ranged from 18-900. In addition, over 12,000 fuel assistance applications were taken for the LIHEAP program. Also, over 5,000 bed nights were provided at the two homeless shelters.

IRS990ScheduleA.GeneralExplanation: Schedule A, Part II, Line 10, Explanation of Other Income: OTHER RECEIPTS

InvestmentsProgramRelated.Description: INVESTMENT IN AFFILIATE - COMMUNITY CONCEPTS HOUSING CORP.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Effective October 1, 2009, the Agency adopted the provisions of Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes as provided for in the Income Taxes topic of the FASB Accounting Standards Codification; however, this implementation has had no material impact on the Agency's combined financial statements. This statement clarifies the criteria that an individual tax position must satisfy for some or all of the benefits of that position to be recognized in an entity's financial statements. It also prescribes a recognition threshold of more-likely-than-not, and a measurement attribute for all tax positions taken or expected to be taken on a tax return, in order for those tax positions to be recognized in the financial statements. There was no cumulative effect on the Agency's combined financial statements related to the adoption of these provisions, and no interest or penalties related to uncertain tax positions were accrued. The Agency is currently open to audit under the statute of limitations by the Internal Revenue Service and state taxing authorities for years ended September 30, 2007 through 2010.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: PROVISION OF VARIOUS SOCIAL SERVICES AND OTHER BENEFITS TO ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS, INCLUDING TRANSPORTATION, HOUSING-RELATED ASSISTANCE, COUNSELING SERVICES, DAY CARE AND OTHER CHILD DEVELOPMENT SERVICES, AND SIMILAR PROGRAMS
Form990ScheduleIPartIII.MethodOfValuation: NON-CASH ASSISTANCE STATED AT COST OF DELIVERY OF SAME
Form990ScheduleIPartIII.DescriptionOfNonCashAssistance: TRANSPORTATION,HOUSING, CHILD DEVELOPMENT, COUNSELING, AND SIMILAR TYPES OF SERVICES AND BENEFITS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Through continuing relationships with grantees.

Form990ScheduleLPartIII.TypeOfAssistance: Transportation and counseling service for son. Amount $ 1000.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S HEAD START POLICY COUNCIL IS PROVIDED REPRESENTATION ON THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S HEAD START POLICY COUNCIL PROVIDES INPUT ON DECISIONS BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RELATING TO THE HEAD START PROGRAM.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 WAS PREPARED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S PUBLIC ACCOUNTANT AND REVIEWED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCE COMMITTEE, AND THEN PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO SUBMISSION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The conflict of interest policy is monitored for compliance by multiple funding sources during their reviews of the agency and also self-monitored by the Board of Directors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The compensation of the CEO is determined by the Board of Directors based on comparable salary studies for the non-profit industry. The compensation for the CFO and COO is determined by the CEO based on comparable salary information of other non-profits.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: This process has not changed from the prior year.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part IV, Line 12 and Part XI, Line 2d:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Organization was included in audited combined financial statements with supplemental combining schedules.
